title: Epilogue

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: The war is, at long last, over. Thank you, my friends. My words cannot express my thanks...

dialogue.speaker: Kris
dialogue.line: Sire, you did it...

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.line: I did it! And thus marks the end of the Legend of the Knight Luke!

dialogue.speaker: Rody
dialogue.line: The war is over. I can return to my motherland at last.

dialogue.speaker: Cecille
dialogue.line: Prince Marth... Kris... Everyone...

dialogue.speaker: Gordon
dialogue.line: Prince Marth really did it! Now, peace will reign forever...

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.line: W-we really did it...

dialogue.speaker: Draug
dialogue.line: I'm sure the people throughout the lands will be joyous.

dialogue.speaker: Arran
dialogue.line: My dream has been fulfilled... Now, I can go without regrets...

dialogue.speaker: Malicia
dialogue.line: Granny... We did it. We did it!

dialogue.speaker: Catria
dialogue.line: Prince Marth... I'm glad...

dialogue.speaker: Warren
dialogue.line: And now... back to my old life.

dialogue.speaker: Cord
dialogue.line: Time to celebrate our victory. I'mma go wild tonight!

dialogue.speaker: Linde
dialogue.line: Darkness may return time and time again... But the light will forever shine on.

dialogue.speaker: Palla
dialogue.line: It was a long war. But now, finally...

dialogue.speaker: Bord
dialogue.line: Jus' tonight, I'm gonna drink until I fall and then some!

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.line: It's over, at last...

dialogue.speaker: Matthis
dialogue.line: What? It's over? I'm not... dead?

dialogue.speaker: Wrys
dialogue.line: The most important thing is that peace has returned.

dialogue.speaker: Ogma
dialogue.line: The war is over. I must inform King Talys of the good news...

dialogue.speaker: Yuliya
dialogue.line: Father, mother... It's finally over...

dialogue.speaker: Yubello
dialogue.line: Lorenz... I'll keep on working hard.

dialogue.speaker: Castor
dialogue.line: Mother, I'm comin' back soon.

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: I'm glad... Marth is safe...

dialogue.speaker: Barst
dialogue.line: Yeah! Time to drink the night away for a change.

dialogue.speaker: Rickard
dialogue.line: Heh heh, I wonder how much treasure I can get my hands on?

dialogue.speaker: Frey
dialogue.line: Splendid battle, sire.

dialogue.speaker: Norne
dialogue.line: Was I of use, I wonder?

dialogue.speaker: Samto
dialogue.line: Oh yeah, now I'll become famous, too.

dialogue.speaker: Wendell
dialogue.line: Lord Gotoh... People have once again overcome their fate...

dialogue.speaker: Caesar
dialogue.line: Please hang in there. I'll be back soon, I promise...

dialogue.speaker: Radd
dialogue.line: We can save her now...

dialogue.speaker: Navarre
dialogue.line: Prince Marth... well done.

dialogue.speaker: Feena
dialogue.line: Shall I show everyone my victory dance?

dialogue.speaker: Cain
dialogue.line: A splendid battle, and a splendid victory!

dialogue.speaker: Bantu
dialogue.line: With the war past us, I shall watch over the world quietly...

dialogue.speaker: Roger
dialogue.line: New world, new encounters... Sounds good to me.

dialogue.speaker: Jeorge
dialogue.line: Now, Archanea will return to its former glory...

dialogue.speaker: Minerva
dialogue.line: Splendid work, Prince Marth. You've managed the feat that nobody else could have done...

dialogue.speaker: Etzel
dialogue.line: The era of war is over... The peaceful world she wanted will now come to fruition...

dialogue.speaker: Merric
dialogue.line: As long as Prince Marth and the others are around... No age of darkness threatens us.

dialogue.speaker: Elrean
dialogue.line: Alone, I couldn't possibly accomplish something like this. So this is the power of friendship...

dialogue.speaker: Dice
dialogue.line: Once I get my reward from the prince, I'mma gamble like no tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: Maris
dialogue.line: Its over, it's really over. Y'know, I'm lookin' forward to my reward.

dialogue.speaker: Horace
dialogue.line: My people will surely be overjoyed...

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.line: Anna, we did it. I'll tell you all about it, later!

dialogue.speaker: Darros
dialogue.line: Well, whadya know? A hopeless guy like me was o' use to Prince Marth...

dialogue.speaker: Robert
dialogue.line: The people will be oppressed no longer.

dialogue.speaker: Belf
dialogue.line: General Camus, the Shadow Dragon has been vanquished. It's all over now.

dialogue.speaker: Leiden
dialogue.line: If only General Camus were here to see us... That's my only regret.

dialogue.speaker: Beck
dialogue.line: Well, I reckon it's time I start a new journey...

dialogue.speaker: Athena
dialogue.line: Ve von. Ve must thank every vun.

dialogue.speaker: Xane
dialogue.line: A world of men, huh? Well, I guess it ain't so bad...

dialogue.speaker: Tiki
dialogue.line: Yay! I'm so happy!

dialogue.speaker: Est
dialogue.line: It's finally over. Abel, I...

dialogue.speaker: Dolph
dialogue.line: This war may be over. But the battle for our motherland's true peace begins now.

dialogue.speaker: Abel
dialogue.line: The war is over at last. The days of peace and tranquility will soon return...

dialogue.speaker: Macellan
dialogue.line: Now, the people of Archanea need suffer no longer.

dialogue.speaker: Astram
dialogue.line: So I was mistaken... I must work to make amends.

dialogue.speaker: Katarina
dialogue.line: Prince Marth... Kris... I'm so happy...

dialogue.speaker: Tomas
dialogue.line: Archanea and Gra... will surely improve now... That's what I want to believe.

dialogue.speaker: Sheema
dialogue.line: My country's fate will finally change... You have my thanks, Prince Marth.

dialogue.speaker: Samson
dialogue.line: ...'Twas a good battle.

dialogue.speaker: Frost
dialogue.line: Now my family will finally be able to live in peace.

dialogue.speaker: Roshea
dialogue.line: Coyote... Did you see us...?

dialogue.speaker: Vyland
dialogue.line: I still have my doubts. But, it was better this way...

dialogue.speaker: Sedgar
dialogue.line: Coyote...

dialogue.speaker: Midia
dialogue.line: My nation has collapsed... But even so, I shall continue to live as a knight of Archanea.

dialogue.speaker: Ymir
dialogue.line: Marth is amazing. I worked hard, too.

dialogue.speaker: Michalis
dialogue.line: It was obvious we'd prevail. You had me on your side, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Nagi
dialogue.line: This is... good...

dialogue.speaker: Lena
dialogue.line: Julian... It was only because you were there that I could...

dialogue.speaker: Maria
dialogue.line: Michalis... Minerva... Can we be a happy family again...?

dialogue.speaker: Nyna
dialogue.line: Camus... you're...

dialogue.speaker: Elice
dialogue.line: Merric... Thank you...

dialogue.speaker: Gotoh
dialogue.line: Marth, brave prince of Altea. Thanks to your valiant efforts, Shadow Dragon Medeus has been completely obliterated. Medeus's servants--the earth dragons-- have once again returned to darkness. As long as the Binding Shield exists, they will never see the light again. Marth, the chosen Prince of Light, descendant of the hero Anri. You have not only saved mankind, but us dragonkin as well...

dialogue.speaker: Tiki
dialogue.line: Mar-Mar!! Does this mean I don't need to go back to the Ice Dragon Shrine anymore? I'm so happy! I love being with everyone, after all. I don't want to be all alone ever again. This is like... a dream come true. I'm so happy, so very happy. I love you, Mar-Mar!!

dialogue.speaker: Malicia
dialogue.line: Honestly, Tiki, for how long do you plan on hogging Prince Marth? Prince Marth looks like he's enjoying it too. Doesn't he worry that you might get mad, Princess Caeda?

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: Please Malicia, you're so silly. But you're right, Marth looks happy...

dialogue.speaker: Malicia
dialogue.line: Who wouldn't? Especially after having a heavy burden lifted from their shoulders? Prince Marth has always been forced to carry such a heavy responsibility. It must have been hard on him. But Princess, you didn't have an easy time either, am I right? With everyone surrounding Marth day and night, you could seldom talk to him. You must have felt lonely.

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: Yes I did... but it's alright. As long as Marth is safe, I have no other wish. You see, I prayed to God. When I found out Marth had been tasked with such an important mission, I asked for God to take my life, should Marth ever have to sacrifice his... That's all I could do for Marth.

dialogue.speaker: Malicia
dialogue.line: ...Sigh, I give up. There's no way I could compare to you, Princess. But, you'll have to wait no longer. Because your prince has finally come back to you. Look, Princess, he's looking over here. Be brave!

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: Marth...

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: Caeda, it's finally over. I've made you suffer, too. Please accept my apologies.

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: No, I'm the one who ought to apologize... I wasn't any help to you.

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: Don't be silly. I've only come this far because you were by my side, Caeda. And besides, the hard part begins now. The seven kingdoms of Archanea are to be unified. And everyone expects me to accept responsibility of the new kingdom. However, there's no way I could handle such a position by myself. Caeda, I want your assistance. I need you.

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: Marth, let me tell you something... When I left Talys, I made a vow. I swore that I would go wherever you went, and that I'd trust you no matter what happened. So, no matter how painful the war was, I was able to endure. Because, Marth... I...

dialogue.speaker: Jagen
dialogue.line: Sire... You've done such a magnificent job. I'm speechless for words.

dialogue.speaker: Arran
dialogue.line: The fact I could devote my last moments to fight under Prince Marth's banner is my life's pride.

dialogue.speaker: Cain
dialogue.line: Truly! We're honored to be by the prince's side.

dialogue.speaker: Abel
dialogue.line: Yes. Even though I'm no knight now... fighting together with Prince Marth was my honor.

dialogue.speaker: Elice
dialogue.line: Marth... Please be happy from now on...

dialogue.speaker: Draug
dialogue.line: Seems we'll be busy from now on! All the kingdoms need to be rebuilt, so we have a mountain of work to do.

dialogue.speaker: Frey
dialogue.line: True. And yet, we can see hope in the eyes of all people.

dialogue.speaker: Gordon
dialogue.line: If we work hard now, we can turn the world onto the right path... That's what I truly believe.

dialogue.speaker: Norne
dialogue.line: I'm sure the people of this world have received that hope. Because of Prince Marth...

dialogue.speaker: Ryan
dialogue.line: W-we've won? It feels so unreal... Somebody pinch me--ouch!

dialogue.speaker: Luke
dialogue.line: Hey, you asked for it! But truly, our battles will be told as legends for generations to come!

dialogue.speaker: Rody
dialogue.line: Getting carried away, I see... But, I'm glad everyone from the 7th Platoon is safe.

dialogue.speaker: Cecil
dialogue.line: Yup. The fact we can laugh together as friends like this is what pleases me the most. And Katarina, that you includes you of course.

dialogue.speaker: Katarina
dialogue.line: Yes... I feel everyone's happiness as well. Kris...

dialogue.speaker: Kris
dialogue.line: Yes, we'll be together forever.

dialogue.speaker: Wrys
dialogue.line: The bonds of people are truly a wondrous sight, no matter your age.

dialogue.speaker: Yubello
dialogue.line: Ah, Sir Sirius? Where did he go? He was here until a moment ago...

dialogue.speaker: Yuliya
dialogue.line: It's okay, Yubello. We must become stronger from here on. I'm sure Sirius wanted that, too...

dialogue.speaker: Roger
dialogue.line: I gotta return to Grust and work hard to rebuild my motherland. Say Malicia, you, er, wanna go back with me?

dialogue.speaker: Malicia
dialogue.line: Sorry, but this girl's taken. I have to look for my prince, after all!

dialogue.speaker: Belf
dialogue.line: Robert, Leiden. Let's move out.

dialogue.speaker: Robert
dialogue.line: Understood. We shall now become knights who protect the weak.

dialogue.speaker: Leiden
dialogue.line: That's what General Camus would have wanted us to do.

dialogue.speaker: Minerva
dialogue.line: Palla, Catria, Est. The war is finally over. You've done well.

dialogue.speaker: Palla
dialogue.line: Commander, your ideal world where all can live in peace... It may finally become a reality.

dialogue.speaker: Catria
dialogue.line: I agree. As long as Prince Marth is here, I'm sure it will...

dialogue.speaker: Est
dialogue.line: Oh, that's right. Let's all go to Altea. We must thank Prince Marth!

dialogue.speaker: Maria
dialogue.line: Ooh, I would love that! I want to see his dashingness too!

dialogue.speaker: Matthis
dialogue.line: Lena! I was worried about you. Tell me, did Julian make any distasteful advances on you?

dialogue.speaker: Julian
dialogue.line: Hey, and why would I do somethin' like that? C'mon, at a time like this...!

dialogue.speaker: Lena
dialogue.line: Teehee, I see you two have been getting along while I was away.

dialogue.speaker: Rickard
dialogue.line: Chief, don't you leave me behind! We vowed to stay together, didn't we?

dialogue.speaker: Warren
dialogue.line: ...I don't like the noise. But, I've discovered the worth of friendship. Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: Caeda
dialogue.line: Ogma, fellow Talysians. I must express my gratitude to you all for protecting Marth in my stead...

dialogue.speaker: Cord
dialogue.line: Princess, we'd go through hell and high water for you and yer husband.

dialogue.speaker: Bord
dialogue.line: Well, that and Ogma asked us to. Right, boss?

dialogue.speaker: Ogma
dialogue.line: Yeah. Bord, Cord, you did well. Barst, you helped a lot too.

dialogue.speaker: Barst
dialogue.line: It was nothin'. I just wanted to live my days in peace again.

dialogue.speaker: Castor
dialogue.line: It's time I return to me hometown. Thankfully, I've saved up a lot of gold.

dialogue.speaker: Darros
dialogue.line: I should try and earn money too, but by doing honest work instead.

dialogue.speaker: Linde
dialogue.line: Princess Nyna! Oh, Princess, I'm so glad you're safe...

dialogue.speaker: Nyna
dialogue.line: Linde... I apologize for making you worry.

dialogue.speaker: Astram
dialogue.line: Midia, I'm sorry. I was overtaken by anger and forgot what was most important.

dialogue.speaker: Midia
dialogue.line: You needn't apologize, Astram. Just don't ever leave my side again...

dialogue.speaker: Jeorge
dialogue.line: Good heavens, it seems we're in the way here. Sir Horace, where might you off to?

dialogue.speaker: Horace
dialogue.line: I must inform the people about the advent of peace.

dialogue.speaker: Dolph
dialogue.line: Macellan, I shall not return to the military.

dialogue.speaker: Macellan
dialogue.line: Yeah, we oughta try and rebuild Archanea as part of its people.

dialogue.speaker: Tomas
dialogue.line: I'm coming along too. For the people of Archanea...

dialogue.speaker: Radd
dialogue.line: It's over at last. Now, we can save her. Aren't you glad, Caesar?

dialogue.speaker: Caesar
dialogue.line: Of course. And I have you to thank, Radd.

dialogue.speaker: Feena
dialogue.line: W-Wait, Navarre! Where're you going? Don't forget me! Wait for meeee!

dialogue.speaker: Samto
dialogue.line: Navarre! I want to become your disciple. Wait for meee!

dialogue.speaker: Jake
dialogue.line: Well, s'bout time I went back to Anna. Beck, what're you going to do?

dialogue.speaker: Beck
dialogue.line: I was reckonin' about a new journey. Let us meet by Anna's shop again, someday.

dialogue.speaker: Ymir
dialogue.line: I'm goin' back to the village. Everyone is waitin' for me.

dialogue.speaker: Athena
dialogue.line: Ve... Ve finally repaid favor. This voman vill return to her country...

dialogue.speaker: Frost
dialogue.line: I'm heading back home to my family. You two are really close, aren't you? You kinda remind me of my family.

dialogue.speaker: Dice
dialogue.line: That we are. Oh yeah, this 'ole family talk reminds me: I can't stay gamblin' forever. Gotta find a man for mah hardworkin' gal. Right, Maris?

dialogue.speaker: Maris
dialogue.line: Quit yer nonsense, Pops! I don't want no man!

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
dialogue.line: ...So it's over.

dialogue.speaker: Sedgar
dialogue.line: Yeah. Everything is...

dialogue.speaker: Roshea
dialogue.line: Coyote, did we do the right thing...?

dialogue.speaker: Vyland
dialogue.line: No, Roshea. Never question yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
dialogue.line: That's right. We must continue to fight. To clear Coyote's name.

dialogue.speaker: Wendell
dialogue.line: At last, a world without war is born. Merric, Elrean, you both did well.

dialogue.speaker: Elrean
dialogue.line: Teacher! The words you spoke to me... I think I understand them now. I must apologize to Merric...

dialogue.speaker: Merric
dialogue.line: Elrean... No apology is needed; I'm your friend. Ever since the day we met.

dialogue.speaker: Etzel
dialogue.line: Seeing the bonds of people dissolving the conflicts between them... 'Tis a promising new world indeed.

dialogue.speaker: Sheema
dialogue.line: The war is over. Samson, will you... stay with me from now on?

dialogue.speaker: Samson
dialogue.line: Didn't I already give you my answer, Sheema? I'll go anywhere you wish.

dialogue.speaker: Tiki
dialogue.line: Ban-Ban! Let's go to the village together again. It's been so long, I wanna see everyone!

dialogue.speaker: Bantu
dialogue.line: Ooh, indeed. Once they see your smile, I'm sure they'll all be happy, too.

dialogue.speaker: Xane
dialogue.line: Those guys are so carefree. But I suppose I can start slacking off as well.

dialogue.speaker: Nagi
dialogue.line: Indeed. I, too, can finally... return to my eternal sleep...

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: Thank you, Kris. For protecting and supporting me. No amount of thanks would be enough. But, among the people, your deeds are being told as things I've done alone... That just will not do. Once we return to the castle, I'll...

dialogue.speaker: Kris
dialogue.line: If you allow me, sire... I have no need for a name. I don't want stories to be told of me.

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: Kris...?

dialogue.speaker: Kris
dialogue.line: Sire. With this war now over, a hero will be needed. A hero called Prince Marth. There are still hostilities between people who have fought for so long. Those won't disappear easily. In order to have everyone's agreement, a king everyone recognizes-- a godlike hero is needed. And that hero must be you, sire, and you alone.

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: But then, what you've done so far will be...

dialogue.speaker: Kris
dialogue.line: Even if the world doesn't know, you do, sire, and that's enough for me. I shall stay by your side. I shall be your shadow.

dialogue.speaker: Marth
dialogue.line: Kris... You're... ...Why, I wonder? Ever since we met, I felt a special connection with you. Fate sent you to me... I can't help but think that. Thank you, Kris. Please stay with me. Kris, you're my other half, my true friend...

narration: Thus, the long, tragic battle that would later be called the 'War of Heroes' finally came to an end. The seven kingdoms were unified under Prince Marth of Altea, and as the United Kingdom of Archanea was established, an era of peace began. The tales of the heroes who took part in this war brought excitement and tears to the later generations. Chronicles of the Archanean War of Heroes.. This is a story of love and courage, about the young warriors who fought with the continent's fate at stake...
